metadata.title: USN-6119-1 -- OpenSSL vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Matt Caswell discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled certain ASN.1 object identifiers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2023-2650)  Anton Romanov discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled AES-XTS cipher decryption on 64-bit ARM platforms. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.10, and Ubuntu 23.04. (CVE-2023-1255)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6119-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libssl-dev - 3.0.8-1ubuntu1.2 openssl - 3.0.8-1ubuntu1.2 libssl-doc - 3.0.8-1ubuntu1.2 libssl3 - 3.0.8-1ubuntu1.2 No subscription required
